input_text:
Job Title: Lineage Supervisor Management Program

Location: Fort Worth, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Join Lineage's 7th Annual Operations Management Trainee Program and immerse yourself in every aspect of our operations. This intensive training program is designed to prepare you for future leadership roles within Lineage’s warehouse operations. Collaborate closely with seasoned professionals from our Operations and Sales teams, benefiting from their expertise and guidance in a supportive environment.

Upon graduation from this 20-week rotational training program, you will become a front-line Warehouse Supervisor responsible for leading a team of experienced warehouse associates to the next level of performance.

If you're ready to embark on a journey of growth and development, apply now to become a part of Lineage's Operations Management Trainee Program.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:

Engage in educational sessions focused on fundamental concepts and leadership principles.Learn through hands-on experience alongside experienced leaders, following the shadow-do-lead methodology.Assist in achieving warehouse performance targets related to cost, productivity, customer service, and profitability.Support the day-to-day management of operational procedures, including product movement, resource allocation, and documentation.Ensure compliance with local safety regulations, fostering a culture of safety among team members.Complete all playbook tasks and obtain sign-off by the program's conclusion.Meet performance goals and targets set by upper management upon accepting the position.

Minimum Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, business management, logistics management, or a related field; or equivalent experience (2 years relevant civilian or military experience).Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and basic computer skills.Eagerness to learn from the ground up and develop necessary skills for success.Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage with individuals at all organizational levels.Effective presentation skills for communicating with customers, clients, and employees.Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a knack for navigating ambiguity.Ability to work in various temperature environments, including cold storage (-20°F/-25°C) and dry storage (up to 100°F/37°C), while adhering to safety protocols and wearing provided protective gear.Comfortable with varying noise levels, as some locations may be loud.

Why Lineage?

This is an excellent position to begin your career path within Lineage! Success in this role enables greater responsibilities and promotions! A career at Lineage starts with learning about our business and how each team member plays a part each and every day to satisfy our customers’ requirements. Beyond that, you’ll help us grow and learn on our journey to be the very best employer in our industry. We’ll ask you for your opinion and ensure we do our part to keep you developing and engaged as we grow our business. Working at Lineage is energizing and enjoyable. We value respect and care about our team members.

Lineage is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and is committed to compliance with all federal, state, and local laws that prohibit workplace discrimination and unlawful harassment and retaliation. Lineage will not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical or mental disability or any other protected status under federal, state and local law.

Benefits

Lineage provides safe, stable, reliable work environments, medical, dental, and basic life and disability insurance benefits, 401k retirement plan, paid time off, annual bonus eligibility, and a minimum of 7 holidays throughout the calendar year.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
